content: jill s shawl created by lisa overby shawl/scarf is knit with drops sky a super soft dk weight wool/alpaca yarn that is lightweight and warm ©2019 yarn twisters 1 jill s shawl materials & info abbreviations yarn drops sky 50g 190m c1 - 2 balls colour 2 light bobble - bind off grey c2 - 1 ball colour 8 purple grey cdd - slip 2 stitches as if to k2tog knit 1 pass 2 gauge 15 sts by 34 row in garter slipped stitches together over the knit stitch 2 stitches decreased needles 4 5mm us 7 32 circular co - cast on notions darning needle stitch marker k - knit finished size length - 221 cm/88 width - 26 cm/10 5 kfb - knit into the front of the stitch leaving on the left hand needle knit into the back of the same stitch dropping the stitch off the left hand needle 1 stitch increased p - purl st/sts - stitch/stitches pattern instructions with c1 co 3 sts section 2 set up with colour 2 row 1 kfb kfb k1 5 sts row 1 rs kfb k to 1 st before marked st cdd k to 2 sts remaining kfb k1 row 2 k2 p1 k2 row 2 ws k to marked st p1 k to end row 3 kfb k2 kfb k1 7 sts with colour 1 row 4 k3 p1 k3 row 3 rs kfb k1 to 1 st before marked st cdd k to section 1 2 sts remaining kfb k1 row 1 rs kfb k1 cdd place a locking st marker on row 4 ws k to marked st p1 k to end this st move st marker up as shawl progresses k to 2 sts remaining kfb k1 repeat row 1 to 4 fifty-four more times or until you run out of colour 2 row 2 ws kfb k to marked st p1 k to 2 sts remain- ing kfb k1 2 sts increased section 3 row 3 kfb k to 1 st before the marked st cdd k to 2 with colour 1 sts remaining kfb k1 row 1 rs kfb k to 1 st before marker cdd k to 2 row 4 kfb k to marked st p1 k to 2 sts remaining sts remaining kfb k1 kfb k1 2 sts increased row 2 ws k to marked st p1 k to end repeat row 3 & 4 thirty-four more times 77 sts repeat row 1 & 2 twenty-four more times bobble all sts weave in ends block and enjoy ©2019 yarn twisters 2 jill s shawl
